derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Latin aqua marina 'seawater'

entry.def: Aquamarines are clear, greenish-blue stones, sometimes used to make jewellery.
Aquamarine is used to describe things that are greenish-blue in colour.

example.tran: 暖洋洋的蓝绿色海面和白色沙滩
海蓝色缎子做的华贵套装

means.word_mean: 1. a transparent variety of beryl that is blue green in color
2. a shade of blue tinged with green

auth_sentence.content: Tanned Scandinavian families frolic in the aquamarine sea, while other parents feed their children at the beachside restaurant.

auth_sentence.content: The white sand, aquamarine sea, coco-de-mer palm trees oh, and a black pearl farm, right on the doorstep had me hooked.
